meanings.definition: To change the arrangement or formation of something.
meanings.sent1: She reconfigured her room by moving the furniture around.
meanings.sent2: The IT team reconfigured the network to improve speed.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reconfigure his sandwich to fit in the tiny lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces reconfigured into a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent5: The garden was reconfigured into a stunning botanical display.

meanings.definition: To adapt or adjust something to a new or different purpose.
meanings.sent1: They reconfigured the old warehouse into a modern office space.
meanings.sent2: The company reconfigured its marketing strategy for the new product launch.
meanings.sent3: She reconfigured her scarf into a makeshift headband.
meanings.sent4: His mind reconfigured the problem, finding a creative solution.
meanings.sent5: The artist reconfigured the painting, adding new elements for depth.
